lead_paragraph: As the debate over possible departures from the euro heats up, there seems to a lot of confusion over the possible uses of devaluation. The main argument I'm hearing goes like this: since Greece's debt is in euros, devaluing won't relieve the debt burden -- so it won't help.
snippet: Exchange rate flexibility doesn't solve fiscal problems by itself -- but it makes solving such problems much easier.
abstract: Exchange rate flexibility doesn't solve fiscal problems by itself -- but it makes solving such problems much easier.
